intro: Helleboroides, commonly known as the Christmas rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Berberidaceae. It is characterized by its early spring blooming, with showy white or pink flowers that appear before the leaves. The plants are native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. Helleboroides species are evergreen perennials with thick, fleshy rhizomes and are often cultivated for their ornamental value. They prefer cool, moist, well-drained soils and partial shade.
